metadata.title: CVE-2020-28200 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
The Sieve engine in Dovecot before 2.3.15 allows Uncontrolled Resource Consumption, as demonstrated by a situation with a complex regular expression for the regex extension.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-auth-lua - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-core - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-lucene - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-solr - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
dovecot-submissiond - 1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> per upstream, fixing this is a massive change that cannot be backported to earlier releases

criterions.comment: dovecot package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.3.16+dfsg1-3ubuntu3').
